page.title: 01Cley Hall & Corsley, Wilts
page.content: Corsley is situated in undulating Wiltshire countryside. It is rural in character and almost entirely used for agricultural purposes. It is bisected by the A362 Frome-Warminster road. South of the A362 the land is largely either managed or leased to tenant farmers by Longleat estate. To the north the land level falls to Rodden Brook which flows into the River Frome. Corsley Heath, the most densely populated hamlet, provides the village hall, playing field and post office. The mother church and the primary school are situated on the northern edge of the village. There is one further anglican church and one chapel. The 36 miles of roads within Corsley, link the scattered hamlets. The majority of the working population commute to local towns.
